Class OutputChannel

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object

      • message

        public void message(User user,
           String message)
        Send a message to the given user in the given channel in this format: user: message. Very useful for responding directly to a command
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel to send the message to
        user - The user to recieve the message in the channel
        message - The message to send

      • cycle

        public void cycle()
        Part and rejoin specified channel. Useful for obtaining auto privileges after identifying
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel to part and join from. Note that the object will be invalid after this method executes and a new one will be created

      • cycle

        public void cycle(String key)
        Part and rejoin specified channel using channel key. Useful for obtaining auto privileges after identifying
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel to part and join from. Note that the object will be invalid after this method executes and a new one will be created
        key - The key to use when rejoining the channel

      • who

        public void who()

      • getMode

        public void getMode()

      • setMode

        public void setMode(String mode)
        Set the mode of a channel. This method attempts to set the mode of a channel. This may require the bot to have operator status on the channel. For example, if the bot has operator status, we can grant operator status to "Dave" on the #cs channel by calling setMode("#cs", "+o Dave"); An alternative way of doing this would be to use the op method.
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel on which to perform the mode change.
        mode - The new mode to apply to the channel. This may include zero or more arguments if necessary.
        See Also:
        #op(org.pircbotx.Channel, org.pircbotx.User)

      • setMode

        public void setMode(String mode,
           Object... args)
        Set a mode for the channel with arguments. Nicer way to pass arguments than with string concatenation. See #setMode(org.pircbotx.Channel, java.lang.String) for more information
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel on which to perform the mode change.
        mode - The new mode to apply to the channel. This may include zero or more arguments if necessary.
        args - Arguments to be passed to the mode. All will be converted to a string using Object.toString() and added together with a single space separating them

      • setMode

        public void setMode(String mode,
           User user)
        Set a mode for a user. See #setMode(org.pircbotx.Channel, java.lang.String)
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel on which to perform the mode change.
        mode - The new mode to apply to the channel.
        user - The user to perform the mode change on
        See Also:
        #setMode(org.pircbotx.Channel, java.lang.String)

        Attempt to set the channel limit (+l) to specified value. May require operator privileges in the channel
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel to set the limit on
        limit - The maximum amount of people that can be in the channel

      • setChannelKey

        public void setChannelKey(String key)
        Sets the channel key (+k) or password to get into the channel. May require operator privileges in the channel
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel to preform the mode change on
        key - The secret key to use

      • removeChannelKey

        public void removeChannelKey(String key)
        Removes the channel key (-k) or password to get into the channel. May require operator privileges in the channel
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel to preform the mode change on
        key - The secret key to remove. If this is not known a blank key or asterisk might work

      • ban

        public void ban(String hostmask)
        Bans a user from a channel. An example of a valid hostmask is "*!*compu@*.18hp.net". This may be used in conjunction with the kick method to permanently remove a user from a channel. Successful use of this method may require the bot to have operator status itself.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to ban the user from.
        hostmask - A hostmask representing the user we're banning.

      • unBan

        public void unBan(String hostmask)
        Unbans a user from a channel. An example of a valid hostmask is "*!*compu@*.18hp.net". Successful use of this method may require the bot to have operator status itself.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to unban the user from.
        hostmask - A hostmask representing the user we're unbanning.

      • op

        public void op(User user)
        Grants operator privileges to a user on a channel. Successful use of this method may require the bot to have operator status itself.
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel we're opping the user on.
        user - The user we are opping.

      • deOp

        public void deOp(User user)
        Removes operator privileges from a user on a channel. Successful use of this method may require the bot to have operator status itself.
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel we're deopping the user on.
        user - The user we are deopping.

      • voice

        public void voice(User user)
        Grants voice privileges to a user on a channel. Successful use of this method may require the bot to have operator status itself.
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel we're voicing the user on.
        user - The user we are voicing.

      • deVoice

        public void deVoice(User user)
        Removes voice privileges from a user on a channel. Successful use of this method may require the bot to have operator status itself.
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel we're devoicing the user on.
        user - The user we are devoicing.

      • halfOp

        public void halfOp(User user)
        Grants owner privileges to a user on a channel. Successful use of this method may require the bot to have operator or halfOp status itself.

        Warning: Not all IRC servers support this. Some servers may even use it to mean something else!

        Parameters:
        chan -
        user -

      • deHalfOp

        public void deHalfOp(User user)
        Removes owner privileges to a user on a channel. Successful use of this method may require the bot to have operator or halfOp status itself.

        Warning: Not all IRC servers support this. Some servers may even use it to mean something else!

        Parameters:
        chan -
        user -

        public void owner(User user)

        Warning: Not all IRC servers support this. Some servers may even use it to mean something else!

        Parameters:

      • setTopic

        public void setTopic(String topic)
        Set the topic for a channel. This method attempts to set the topic of a channel. This may require the bot to have operator status if the topic is protected.
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel on which to perform the mode change.
        topic - The new topic for the channel.

      • kick

        public void kick(User user)
        Kicks a user from a channel. This method attempts to kick a user from a channel and may require the bot to have operator status in the channel.
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel to kick the user from.
        user - The user to kick.

      • kick

        public void kick(User user,
        String reason)
        Kicks a user from a channel, giving a reason. This method attempts to kick a user from a channel and may require the bot to have operator status in the channel.
        Parameters:
        chan - The channel to kick the user from.
        user - The user to kick.
        reason - A description of the reason for kicking a user.
